public PrimitiveAdvText(int x,
                        int y,
                        int sx,
                        int sy,
                        int or,
                        int st,
                        java.lang.String t,
                        int l)
Complete constructor.

Parameters:
x - the x position of the control point of the text
y - the y position of the control point of the text
sx - the x size of the font
sy - the y size of the font
or - the orientation of the text
st - the style of the text
t - the text to be used
l - the layer to be used

parseTokens

public void parseTokens(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                        int N)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Parse a token array and store the graphic data for a given primitive Obviously, that routine should be called *after* having recognized that the called primitive is correct. That routine also sets the current layer.

Specified by:
parseTokens in class GraphicPrimitive
Parameters:
tokens - the tokens to be processed. tokens[0] should be the command of the actual primitive.
N - the number of tokens present in the array
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getDistanceToPoint

public int getDistanceToPoint(int px,
                              int py)
Gets the distance (in primitive's coordinates space) between a given point and the primitive. When it is reasonable, the behaviour can be binary (polygons, ovals...). In other cases (lines, points), it can be proportional.

Specified by:
getDistanceToPoint in class GraphicPrimitive
Parameters:
px - the x coordinate of the given point
py - the y coordinate of the given point

getControls

public java.util.Vector getControls()
Get the control parameters of the given primitive.

Overrides:
getControls in class GraphicPrimitive
Returns:
a vector of ParameterDescription containing each control parameter. The first parameters should always be the virtual points.

setControls

public void setControls(java.util.Vector v)
Set the control parameters of the given primitive. This method is specular to getControls().

Overrides:
setControls in class GraphicPrimitive
Parameters:
v - a vector of ParameterDescription containing each control parameter. The first parameters should always be the virtual points.

rotatePrimitive

public void rotatePrimitive(boolean bCounterClockWise,
                            int ix,
                            int iy)
Rotate the primitive. Here we just rotate 90° by 90°

Overrides:
rotatePrimitive in class GraphicPrimitive
Parameters:
bCounterClockWise - specify if the rotation should be done counterclockwise.
ix - the x coordinate of the center of rotation
iy - the y coordinate of the center of rotation

mirrorPrimitive

public void mirrorPrimitive(int xPos)
Mirror the primitive. For the text, it is different than for the other primitives, since we just need to toggle the mirror flag.

Overrides:
mirrorPrimitive in class GraphicPrimitive
Parameters:
xPos - is the symmetry axis
